pros: Millikin fosters an environment of collective growth and is a great place to work!
cons: Located in a relatively remote place

pros: • Small campus • Most people that work here love the people in their department • Great first job
cons: • They will add more work to your plate and not pay you any additional salary • In athletics, if you are not on the football staff, the AD truly doesn’t care about doing what’s best for your program. Priority one is football and there is not negotiations. Even if football goes 0-10.

pros: Some very fine people to work with and the best students anywhere!
cons: Higher Ed. as an industry is in trouble. Learning to become nimble and make adjustments is a lesson in growing pains.

review_title: Good benefits, good work life balance
pros:
The benefits are great. Health insurance is a bit high, but the coverage is great. Also multiple options for different tiered plans.
Vacation time is great. Sick time is also good, and sick time can be rolled over. 
Work life balance was good. Rarely required to work more than 40 hours, and was able to flex time when working more than 40 hours
cons: Pay is on the low end of the scale. Politics on campus became too apparent. Most departments have little or no room for growth.

pros: Friendly faculty and staff that supports one another
cons: Administration somewhat unapproachable, but president seems more in touch

review_title: Poor culture, no budget, don't recommend
job_title: Technical Support Specialist in Decatur, IL
cons: Low salary, understaffed, political work environment,

pros: Scholarship with tuition off and stipend and housing
cons: 40% off tuition where other schools offer more

review_title: Wonderful students that are dedicated to the educational profession.
pros:
Good students
Good colleagues
Beautiful campus
Quality programs
cons:
Does not value your hard work and passion with kind words or salary increases.
Mandates many requirements of the university rather than ask for our help.
Seems that it who you know more than what you know.

pros: They always work with students on their schedules.

review_title: College education is a business and the bills must be paid.
pros: The faculty are supportive and intelligent. The staff are supportive.
cons: Management is having to deal with the fact that enrollment is tied to financial survival. It seems that in some programs students who do not belong are retained inorder to keep enrollment numbers sufficiently high.

pros: Relaxing environment to work in. You can make your own schedule, which is perfect for students with a heavy class load.
cons: I feel like the communication could have been a bit better between faculty and the student workers. Sometimes I felt like I was unwanted if I had a question and approached a superior about it, like I was putting a strain on their day for asking a simple question.

pros: The new theatre space is opening in Fall of 2020.  The excitement is palpable.  Everyone is excited in the direction this established program will go with this new space to hold everyone in the program.
cons: The limitations of the city of Decatur is one of the few cons of this program.

pros: Millikin is moving in the right direction. The people are the best part. Both students and employees love it and have a positive attitude. It is a relaxed environment and usually quite fun.
cons: Dealing with financial aid conversations is always stressful and working for an Illinois institution is not always a great experience.

review_title: Great place to work if you work in the right department
pros: I had the right amount of hours. I was able to work by myself and I had a lot of fun. It face me great experience.
cons: You're working for the university so you get state minimum wage.

pros: Great place to work! I love the environment and people that I work with daily.
cons: I do not have any cons for this company. It is a great place to be employed

review_title: Working on Financial Situation, lots of budget cuts, etc
pros: Great health insurance!!! Long breaks for Christmas holiday.
cons: Little room to move up, depending on department.

job_title: Associate Professor of Marketing in Decatur, IL
pros: Innovative course design is possible, supportive faculty
cons: Lack of transparency and support from administrators
you wont get rich but you will be happy

pros: good people, beautiful campus and eager students
cons: your growth is limited and responsibilities are heavy
